data.title: Cloud Architect
data.description: Location: Charlotte, NC, 28217 - 3 days onsiteDuration: Contract until EOY (2024) - potential for extension or conversionTitle: Sr Cloud Solutions Architect Description: Produce architecture blueprints that guide the development and implementation of Cloud solutions across multiple products, providing direction to technical teams during project delivery and ensuring implementations support technology and product roadmaps. The Cloud Solutions Architect provides their expertise in the development and maintenance of architecture standards and solutions that align with strategic goals and partner with product managers, business analysts, designers, and software engineers to navigate solution decisions. Responsibilities:  Responsible for creating solutions and presenting compelling recommendations to customers.Define operational procedures and practicesAccelerate development for roadmap features, to address specific customer requirementsIdentify ongoing risks and pain points throughout the project, develop and implement mitigation measures.Improve internal processes, and promote knowledge sharing in the team, by contributing to the knowledge base, blogs, and brown bag lunches.Capture project lessons and convert them into architectural best practices applicable to the broader install base; mentor and coach the internal team through internal training sessions.Work closely with Product Management and Engineering to review customer requirements and feedback, and identify opportunities for platform enhancements Skills and Knowledge:Knowledge of enterprise cloud solutions, deploying and running solutions in a cloud environment, and private, public, and hybrid cloudsExtensive experience with Internet technologies and protocols like TCP/IP, VPN, SSL and HTTPHands-on experience with public and private cloud services as well as load balancers and networking devicesExperience designing high availability and disaster recovery / fail-over infrastructuresKnowledge of Open Source architectures and/or past contributions to open source projectsDesign, development and operations experience with highly-available, scalable, and fault tolerant systemsExperience with agile/scrum methodologies Experience securing the cloudExperience setting up the network connectivity to the cloudNeeds to understand the differences of all the work load offeredNeeds to understand the difference in cost between different instancesAbility to setup/teach resiliency and redundancyCan create dashboards and visualize where the money is going and is it being spent correctly

data.title: Cloud Engineer
data.description:
Job Description:Principal Duties and Responsibilities:Applies Software knowledge to assist and support the design, development, creation, modification, and validation of embedded and cloud edge software, applications, and/or specialized utility programs.Analyzes user needs and software requirements.Designs and implements small software features for products and systems.Participates in the design, coding for small features, unit testing, minor debugging fixes, and integration efforts to ensure projects are completed on schedule.Assists in performing code reviews and regression tests as well as the triaging of issues to ensure the quality of code.Collaborates with others inside project team to accomplish project objectives.Writes technical documentation for Software projects.Cloud engineer to develop cloud-based applications & services, design & implement unstructured cloud data (S3) I/O & processing and optimize engineering data pipelines and implement data security for Product Development and Test Engineering department.
Top 5 Required Skills:2 + years of work experience with Python, C#, Shell scripting.Experience with databases PostgreSQL.Experience with AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Aurora Serverless PostgreSQL + S3 + Glue + Athena + File gateway + IAM + Lambda.Experience developing Data Warehouse and schema support.Good Communication Skills.
Technologies:2 years or more experience with databases PostgreSQL.1 year or more experience with AWS Elastic Beanstalk, Aurora Serverless PostgreSQL + S3 + Glue + Athena + File gateway + IAM + Lambda.1 year or more experience developing Data Warehouse and schema support.
Required Education:Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

data.title: Cloud Systems Admin
data.description:
Akkodis is seeking a Cloud Systems Admin for our client based in Baltimore MD. 
Pay Range: $65 -$70/hr on C2C. The pay may be negotiable based on experience, education, geographic location, and other factors.
REQUIRED EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or related field preferred, or equivalent related training and experience2+ years of experience in Systems Administration, Systems Engineering, or related fields or equivalent training and experience.Must be able to obtain Federal security clearance based on Federal/State-related projects.AWS or Azure Certification is a plus but not required.In-depth knowledge of computer systems, including installation and maintenance, on the AWS/Azure platform.Working knowledge of automating deployments within Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment paradigmFamiliarity with supporting container-based applications/servicesBasic knowledge of script languages and IaC tools (ex. Bash, Python, Groovy, PowerShell, Terraform, or Perl)Ability to troubleshoot issues through the full stack (application/networking/infrastructure/OS level)Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with an emphasis on customer serviceProficient documentation and organizational skillsWorking knowledge of source code management/version control (Perforce, git)Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, term life insurance, short-term disability insurance, additional voluntary benefits, commuter benefits, and a 401K plan. Our program allows employees to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria. Disclaimer: These benefit offerings do not apply to client-recruited jobs and jobs that are direct hires to a client.
To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.akkodis.com/en/privacy-policyThe Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

data.title: Geospatial Cloud Engineer
data.description:
Job Title: Geospatial Software EngineerLocation: St Louis, MO 63146 - 3564Duration: 12 Months Job Type: Contract Work Type: RemotePay Rate: $70 - 75$/Hourly/W2
Overview:  TekWissen Group is a workforce management provider throughout the USA and many other countries in the world. This client is a German multinational Pharmaceutical and biotechnology company and one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world, headquartered in Leverkusen, and areas of business include pharmaceuticals; consumer healthcare products, agricultural chemicals, seeds and biotechnology products. 
Description: The Geospatial Software Engineer will be involved in the design of big data solutions that leverage open source and cloud-based solutions within the Location360 enterprise initiative and will work with multiple teams across the organization (i.e. cloud analytics, data architects, business groups). The software engineer will participate in the building of large-scale data processing systems and API’s and should be able to work with the latest open-source technologies.A software engineer should embrace the challenge of dealing with petabytes or even exabytes of data daily in a high-throughput API/microservice ecosystem. A software engineer understands how to apply technologies to solve big data problems and to develop innovative big data solutions. The software engineer generally works on implementing complex projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, analyzing and making available large sets of data to turn information into insights using multiple platforms. The software engineer should be able to develop prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions. This role will drive the engineering and building of geospatial data assets to support client's Field Platform and R&D product pipeline.Key responsibilities include:Design, build and support of cloud and open source systems to process geospatial data assets via an API-based platformPartners with other internal development communities to bring needed data sets into the asset and making data available to the client's Enterprise and internal development communitiesBuilding highly scalable API’s and associative architecture to support thousands of requests per secondProvides leadership in advancing client's understanding of environmental/external influences on field performance and risk factorsWorking at all stages of the software life cycle: Proof of Concept, MVP, Production, and DeprecationMinimum Requirements:BSc degree in Computer Science or relevant job experience.Minimum of 2-year experience with Python, Java, Go, or similar development languages.Extensive knowledge in different programming or scripting languages like Go, Scala, Java, Javascript, SQL, Bash, Python and/or R.Experience developing HTTP APIs (REST and/or GraphQL) that serve up data in an open source technology, preferably in a cloud environment.Ability to build and maintain modern cloud architecture, e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, etc.Experience working with PostgreSQL/PostGIS.Experience with code versioning and dependency management systems such as GitHub, SVT, and Maven.Proven success utilizing Docker to build and deploy within a CI/CD Environment, preferably using Kubernetes.Desirable qualifications:MSc in Computer Science or related field.Demonstrated knowledge of open-source geospatial solutions like GeoServer, GeoTrellis, GeoMesa.Experience with stream processing, e.g. Kafka.Highly proficient (4 years) in GoLangExperience working with customers/other developers to deliver full-stack development solutions e.g collect software, data, and timeline requirements in an Agile environment.Demonstrated knowledge of agriculture and/or agriculture-oriented businesses.Experience implementing complex data projects with a focus on collecting, parsing, managing, and delivery of large sets of data to turn information into insights using multiple platforms.Demonstrated experience adapting to new technologies.Capable to decide on the needed hardware and software design needs and act according to the decisions. The big data engineer should be able to develop prototypes and proof of concepts for the selected solutions.Experience with object-oriented design, coding and testing patterns as well as experience in engineering (commercial or open source) software platforms and large-scale data infrastructures should be present.Experience creating cloud computing solutions and web applications leveraging public and private API’s.Proven experience (2 years) with distributed systems, e.g. Argo, Kubernetes, Spark, distributed databases, grid computing.Proficient (4+ years) working in a Command Line Interface system e.g Docker, Argo, K8s, AWS CLI, GCloud, pSQL, SSHTekWissen® Group is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity.

data.title: Cloud Product Manager
data.description:
Akkodis is seeking a Cloud Product Manager for a contract with a client located in Plano, TX, Atlanta, GA, Chandler, AZ, or Richmond, VA.Pay/Salary Range: $56.17-58.50/hr W2 ONLY12 Month Contract- possibility of extension or perm.Hybrid schedule- onsite 3 days a week, remote 2 days a week. Responsibilities:Creating Service Architecture deliverables consistent with product management principles, standards, methodologies, and best practices from both a bank and industry perspectiveDefining and validating technical requirements, and establishing traceability between requirements and architecture/designDetermining business requirements and approaches to ensure all architectural solutions result in a coherent systems designProviding expert knowledge, support and guidance to business and technology teamsUnderstanding of billing, rates, demand modeling, chargeback, and other financialsReviewing and approving 3rd party and integration solution architecturesFacilitating technical design discussions and sessionsVendor managementCoaching and leadership to Product and serviceConsultantsProviding technical and architectural leadershipQualifications:5+ years of relative experience in Product/Service ManagementConfidence to operate with an entrepreneurial mindset and communication styleAbility to manage a product/service with an owner mentalityUnderstanding how to build networks quickly inside the Bank and leverage themExperience with IT Product Management, and ITIL v3 certificationMBACloud Providers: Azure, Google, AWSContainers: Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShiftExperience in agile development and tooling.Excellent communication, organizational leadership, coaching, and troubleshooting skills.Strong executive presence and the ability to communicate complex technology solutions to senior stakeholders.Critical thinkingSelf-management

If you are interested in this position then please click APPLY NOW. For other opportunities available at Akkodis go to www.akkodis.com. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mackensie Stiff at mackensie.stiff@akkodisgroup.com.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/DisabledBenefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.modis.com/en-us/candidate-privacy/The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

data.title: Program Manager (Cloud Operations)
data.description:
Role: Cloud Operations Program ManagerLocation: Fully remote in the USJob Duration: 6-months with an opportunity to extend or convert to full-timePay: 80 - 85 an hr on W2
Job Description: Identify, analyze, and coordinate cloud operational management duties across all different business areas, working closely with the stakeholders to avoid disruption to the business. Increase Cloud Operational Governance maturity by redesigning current processes according to market Cloud FinOps best practices and company-specific infrastructure requirements. Develop operational methods and manage cloud capacity, identifying and attacking problem areas for infrastructure stakeholders. Prepare manuals and train colleagues to implement quality control objectives, activities, or procedures to resolve production problems and/or maximize product reliability. Analyze statistical data and product specifications and perform mathematical calculations on cloud infrastructure metrics to better understand behavior and areas for improvement in our cloud management operations.
REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Business Analytics, Management, or related field and 2 years of work experience in the job offered or related occupation. Experience or education must include:Operate quota and capacity management tools in AWS, GCP, OCI and AzurePulling data and standardizing queries from large databases using SQLCost management tactics such as enterprise-wide discount programs and commitment plans (Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, Spot, Sustained Use/Committed Use Discounts), rightsizing, scheduling, and environment hygiene (idle resource management)Data analysis programming and querying languages including Python, R, and SQL to create analytical models for data-driven decisions and troubleshoot data quality issues for existing data pipelinesAgile methodologies/DevOps environment and program management-related tools including JIRA

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/DisabledBenefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, term life insurance, short-term disability insurance, additional voluntary benefits, commuter benefits and 401K plan. Our program provides employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria. Disclaimer: These benefit offerings do not apply to client-recruited jobs and jobs which are direct hire to a client**********To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit https://www.modis.com/en-us/candidate-privacy/
The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

data.title: Senior Cloud Engineer (AWS)
data.description:
Optomi, in partnership with a leader in the Logistics/Distribution industry, is seeking an AWS Senior Cloud Engineer to join their team. This senior resource will be in office 50% of the time and 50% of the time work Remotely. 
What the right candidate will Enjoy:Working with cutting-edge technology!A collaborative work environment!A LONG TERM 2+ Year Contract!A 50% Hybrid and 50% Remote schedule!
This Engineer will assist in the migration from on-prem to the cloud (AWS)! There will be hands-on as well as architectural responsibilities!
Required Skills:Need production environment experience!Strong experience with AWS: The right candidate will be recommending what cloud technologies in AWS would be beneficial.Migration from on-prem to cloud experience.The environment is Tibco (on-prem), there will be a rewrite to AWS.

data.title: SAP Public Cloud Consultant
data.description:
Title: SAP Public Cloud Techno-Functional ConsultantLocation: 100% Remote - east coast hoursDuration: 6 month contract + extensions
Required Skills and Experience *- SAP Public Cloud experience with one implementation - Experience with doing both technical and functional (work with the client on updates) - Understand SAP professional services model, if not, SAP project systems - System Integration and Test - User acceptance testing - Data migration experience - Functional Lead and leadership quality Job Description *We are looking for a SAP Public Cloud Engineer to help us with a migration with a client. This client has about 200 end users and they are going off a non SAP platform to Public Cloud, You will be helping them with SIT (system integration test), data migration and cut over and come up to speed on functionalities and changes. Working with the business and new requirements, user acceptance test and making sure user is good with data migration and coaching the client and the right data is extracted with validation. Take them live to SAP Public Cloud. They have 16 objects in dealing with migrations, quality and complexity, but two of them are very complex. We are looking for this person to be comfortable with leading and being the face to the client as well. 200 employees with this customer (end users)

data.title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant
data.description:
Title: Salesforce Developer (Marketing cloud)Location: Columbus, OH (Day 1 onsite, Local Candidate Preferred)Job Type: Contract (12+Months)
Job Description:8+ years experience in handling end to end Email Campaign. Design, build and refine email communications that support internal and external digital campaigns and ongoing requests from the business.Create, deploy and maintain landing pages that promote new programs, advertised assets, product lines and other digital campaign initiatives.Should have experience in mapping the data fields and structures between the old platform and the Salesforce Marketing Cloud.Should have knowledge on how to configure authentication (SPF, DKIM).Collaborate with cross-functional teams to coordinate featured assets and content.Should have knowledge in setup triggers, decision splits, and actions in marketing clouds automation studio.Having Sales Force Marketing Cloud Certification (SFMC) will be added advantage.
Mandatory skills:Sales Force, Email Campaigns, Dynamic Email templates and Segmented campaigns.
Good to have skills:Knowledge of Email studio, JAVA, Sales Force Marketing Cloud Certified, HTML, Analytics skills

data.title: Technical Lead Information Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS) Developer
data.description:
Position: Technical LeadLocation: Onsite @ Orlando, FLskills: Information Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS) DeveloperInformatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC)Cloud Data Integration (IDC)
5+ years of relevant experience of IICS Responsible for the set-up, maintenance and ongoing development of CI/CD continuous build/ integration infrastructure 5+ years relevant experience of Oracle SQL / SQL Server and Stored procedures and should have knowledge on how to debug an Oracle Package/Stored Procedure. Design and development of ETL/ data pipelines using Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services Analyzing the data requirement- Data Sources, Entities for Data Extraction, Data Processing and Loading in Data Lake/Cloud Database Build the high level Design for Database, integration, ETL mapping with IICS toolset Prior production support experience with debugging Cloud data integration platforms (IICS) Analyzing the Reporting requirement- Data Sources, Mapping processed data to Reporting entities for business consumption, Data visualization 3+ years of n-tier Production Support Lead experience in solving critical production issues including ITIL process, RCA, Permanent Fixes, Batch monitoring, Problem Management. Must have experience with supporting large application, Onshore/Offshore teams and direct customer interactions working in shift hours. Must have excellent communication (meeting, phone, verbal and written), interpersonal and presentation skill. Excellent problem solver, quickly analyze and evaluate scenarios to develop appropriate solutions. Open minded, flexible, and willing to listen for other people s opinions and solution-oriented team player. Champion industry best practices, creating Proof of concepts and ability to learn and demonstrate new technologies solutions to customer and team.Nice to have skills- Deep knowledge of IIS configuration, scalability, optimization. Involve in design of LLD, Unit Test Cases & SIT Unit Test Cases Experience in ticketing tool such as Service Now etc Experience in RCA and Problem Management Working experience with Linux. Power Shell scripting. Project management experience would be plus

data.title: Cloud Engineer
data.description:
Req# 141953 - 1 
Role: System Engineer 3Location: RemoteDuration: 12 Months with a chance of extension.
Client: Microsoft 
Hourly Pay Rate: $65/hr. on W2
Summary:The main function of a Systems Engineer is to perform a wide variety of installation, configuration, and upgrading of servers and related hardware and software in a LAN, WAN, and stand-alone environment, providing investigation, diagnostic testing, and repair/resolution of system, hardware, software, and infrastructure.
Job Responsibilities:configuration, installation, and support of equipment to the specifications of the businesssoftware applications and operating systems through regular maintenanceconfiguration and support documentationassigned projects and program components to deliver services by established objectivesthe administration of systems and servers to ensure the availability of services to authorized usersmulti-site network operations, software applications, and operating systems through regular maintenancemalfunctions of hardware, software applications, and security systems to resolve operational issues and restore services.
Qualification:overall years of experience in the field.ideal resume would contain someone who can execute the commands needed.degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering, or related field required.
Purpose of the Team: The purpose of this team is to manage and support critical environment platforms and tooling software programs/applications. Support data centers through central applications. This will be a tier-3 role – expect to run into database commands, scripting, and execution resources to manage their critical platform maintenance application.
Key projects: This role will contribute to operational (80%) and development (20%). CMNS is the main support they control.
Typical Day in the Role: The role will consist of 10% meetings, 40% heads down, and the remaining 50% teamwork (tier-2 team, other resources, learning, and doing).
What makes this role interesting? This role provides the opportunity to support global data centers, scaling un-seen paces, cutting-edge in how they manage it and what they are doing, great team culture, learning, and development. Have a really fun team dynamic and organizational culture.
Top 3 Hard Skills Required:knowledge of IT Systems engineering (5+ YOE)with system capacity and planning, as well as functional configuration and audit (5+ YOE).with system planning and capacity tools and analyses (5+ YOE).
